entry.title: LeetCode 0020 Valid Parentheses
entry.content:
20. Valid Parentheses

Given a string containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

The brackets must close in the correct order, "()" and "()[]{}" are all valid but "(]" and "([)]" are not.

entry.title: LeetCode 0016 3Sum Closest
entry.content:
16. 3Sum Closest

Given an array S of n integers, find three integers in S such that the sum is closest to a given number, target. Return the sum of the three integers. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution.

Analysis:

æœ¬é¢˜ç±»ä¼¼äº15é¢˜ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†ä»£ç å’Œæ€è·¯ä¸15é¢˜ç›¸ä¼¼ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å› ä¸ºè¿™æ¬¡çš„ target ä¸æ˜¯å‡†ç¡®å€¼ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ while å¾ªç¯å†…è¦æ¯”è¾ƒä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°çš„å’Œä¸ target çš„å¤§å°å…³ç³»ï¼Œæ ¹æ®å¤§å°å…³ç³»ç§»åŠ¨ start å’Œ end æŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œå¹¶åœ¨å¾ªç¯å†…æ ¹æ® abs(sums - target) < abs(output - target) æ›´æ–°æœ€æ¥è¿‘çš„ target çš„å’Œï¼Œç›´åˆ°å¾ªç¯ç»“æŸã€‚

Answer:

class Solution:    def threeSumClosest(self, nums, target):        """        :type nums: List[int]        :type target: int        :rtype: int        """        nums.sort()        length, output= len(nums), None        for i in range(length):            if i > 0 and nums[i] == nums[i - 1]:                continue            start, end = i + 1, length - 1            while start < end:                sums = nums[i] + nums[start] + nums[end]                if sums <= target:                    start += 1                else:                    end -= 1                if output is None or abs(sums - target) < abs(output - target):                    output = sums        return output
entry.summary:
16. 3Sum Closest

Given an array S of n integers, find three integers in S such that the sum is closest to a given number, target. Return the sum of the three integers. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution.

entry.title: LeetCode 0015 3Sum
entry.content:
15. 3Sum

Given an array S of n integers, are there elements a, b, c in S such that a + b + c = 0? Find all unique triplets in the array which gives the sum of zero.

Note:

The solution set must not contain duplicate triplets.

entry.title: LeetCode 0014 Longest Common Prefix
entry.content:
14. Longest Common Prefix

Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.

Description:

é¢˜ç›®ç»™çš„æè¿°æœ‰ç‚¹ä¸æ¸…æ™°çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œç»™å‡ºè®¨è®ºåŒºå¥½å¿ƒäººçš„ä¾‹å­å’Œæè¿°ã€‚
æ€»ä½“æ¥è¯´ï¼Œæ˜¯æ±‚å‡ºä¸€ç»„å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ä¸­æ¯ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ä¸²çš„å‰ç¼€å…¬å…±å­ä¸²ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯æ±‚å…¬å…±é”®é—®é¢˜ã€‚

It seems that it is not to check between pair of strings but on all the strings in the array.

For example:

  1. {â€œaâ€,â€œaâ€,â€œbâ€} should give â€œâ€ as there is nothing common in all the 3 strings.

  2. {â€œaâ€, â€œaâ€} should give â€œaâ€ as a is longest common prefix in all the strings.

  3. {â€œabcaâ€, â€œabcâ€} as abc

  4. {â€œacâ€, â€œacâ€, â€œaâ€, â€œaâ€} as a.

Logic goes something like this:

Pick a character at i=0th location and compare it with the character at that location in every string.

  1. If anyone doesnâ€™t have that just return â€œâ€

  2. Else append that character in to the result.

  3. Increment i and do steps 1-3 till the length of that string.

  4. return result.

entry.title: LeetCode 0008 String to Integer (atoi)
entry.content:
8. String to Integer (atoi)

Implement atoi to convert a string to an integer.

Hint:

Carefully consider all possible input cases. If you want a challenge, please do not see below and ask yourself what are the possible input cases.

Notes:

It is intended for this problem to be specified vaguely (ie, no given input specs). You are responsible to gather all the input requirements up front.

Requirements for atoi:

The function first discards as many whitespace characters as necessary until the first non-whitespace character is found. Then, starting from this character, takes an optional initial plus or minus sign followed by as many numerical digits as possible, and interprets them as a numerical value.

The string can contain additional characters after those that form the integral number, which are ignored and have no effect on the behavior of this function.

If the first sequence of non-whitespace characters in str is not a valid integral number, or if no such sequence exists because either str is empty or it contains only whitespace characters, no conversion is performed.

If no valid conversion could be performed, a zero value is returned. If the correct value is out of the range of representable values, INT_MAX (2147483647) or INT_MIN (-2147483648) is returned.

Analysis:

entry.title: LeetCode 0004 Median of Two Sorted Arrays
entry.content:
4. Median of Two Sorted Arrays

There are two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively.

Find the median of the two sorted arrays. The overall run time complexity should be O(log (m+n)).

Example 1:

The median is 2.0

Example 2:

The median is (2 + 3) / 2 = 2.5
